322.name: Children that died before 5 years of age per woman (based on Gapminder (2015))
322.unit: Children that died before 5 years of age per woman
322.description: Children that died before 5 years of age per womanTo calculate this measure the total fertility rate was multilplied by the child mortality rate.
322.datasetName: Children that died before 5 years of age per woman - based on Gapminder (2015)
322.s_name: Children that died before 5 years of age per woman - based on Gapminder (2015)

source.name: Children that died before 5 years of age per woman - based on Gapminder (2015)
source.dataPublishedBy: This data was calculated by Max Roser based on fertility and child mortality estimates from 1800 to 2015 published by Gapminder.org
source.dataPublisherSource: The two Gapminder.org datasets used were: Gapminder child mortality estimates version 8, Gapminder Total Fertility Rate estimates version 6
source.additionalInfo:
Child mortality is the probability that a child born in a specific year will die before reaching the age of five if subject to current age-specific mortality rates.
Child mortality was multiplied by fertility to obtain the data on how many children died on average per woman.

1318.name: Children that survived past their 5th birthday per woman (based on Gapminder (2015))
1318.description: Children that survived past their 5th birthday per woman
1318.datasetName: Children that survived past their 5th birthday per woman - based on Gapminder (2015)
1318.s_name: Children that survived past their 5th birthday per woman - Gapminder (2015)

source.name: Children that survived past their 5th birthday per woman - Gapminder (2015)
source.dataPublishedBy: This data was calculated by Max Roser based on fertility and child mortality estimates from 1800 to 2015 published by Gapminder.org
source.dataPublisherSource: The two Gapminder.org datasets used were: Gapminder child mortality estimates version 8, Gapminder Total Fertility Rate estimates version 6
source.additionalInfo:
The child mortality rate is the probability that a child born in a specific year will die before reaching the age of five if subject to current age-specific mortality rates.
The child survival rate is 1-child mortality rate
Child survival rate was multiplied by fertility to obtain the data on how many children died on average per woman.
